website_summaries.verdict: If you like smaller diaper liners that fit straight off the roll, these are a solid choice. However, keep in mind that you won't be able to customize the size.
pros: Smaller dimensions fit most diapers with no cutting or folding required
100% bamboo viscose material is flushable, compostable, and biodegradable
Soft texture doesn't irritate delicate skin
cons: Might be a bit narrow for large diapers

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t cloth diaper without these!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a complete cloth diapering newbie, but these are a game changer. I tried a few days without these and if your kiddo doesn’t have really solid poop it’s a nasty mess. No thanks. These make life so easy! They’re really soft- I’ve heard some other brands feel like dryer sheets, but these aren’t like that at all, they’re more like a fluffy Kleenex texture. But don’t worry- in case you accidentally get one in the washing machine they won’t break into a million pieces like a Kleenex would. For me that’s a bit disconcerting since I flush them, but so far no plumbing issues!
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Mom MBA

customer_reviews.title: Price went higher
customer_reviews.text: So I previously buy this liners before the covid pandemic started. It was $10 cheaper, now they put up the price to $39.99. Can Amazon check this pricing issue. PLEASE!! Other than that, love the product. My baby never had a rash with it. But please put the original price again!!! We can't afford it since we all not working. We're on our savings and I needed it for my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L.

customer_reviews.title: Best Liner - Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Wide, soft and not translucently thin - I like these way better than the Grovia liners. Also great value. The 600 sheets have lasted me about 9 months with more or less daily use. Although advertised as flushable, I don't take the chance.
customer_reviews.author: Curly Sue

customer_reviews.title: There are better liners out there
customer_reviews.text: I tried this product to see if the value was better than the other liner I have used for the last two years. I will not purchase this product again. The liner shifts with my toddler and baby. So when they poop, the capture is 50/50 at best. Average has a far greater failure rate. I had read that other users had this problem also but decided to try it for myself. So I’m. Or he only one who this product failed on.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat effective
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to use- just plop them into the diaper. I like that they are biodegradable. It doesn’t always catch all of the waste and it doesn’t actually adhere to the diaper but it is somewhat effective at making the diapers less messy.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Supervielle

customer_reviews.title: Probably the cause of diaper rash for both of my kids
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this product because it did make cloth diapering so much easier, but my oldest got pretty bad diaper rash after we started using these. Then with my second, I tried again thinking that my daughter might just have had sensitive skin. Again, terrible diaper rash, so I've quit using them. I'm not sure if its the type of material itself or the chafing that caused the problems. I haven't tried any other brands, so I don't know if the problem is specific to this one or just the liners in general. So now I use them to dust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: They are thin and don’t wade up when on the bum!! They will be our go to liners forever and they last forever because you get so many!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke D.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the money. The wegreeco brand is a little softer but this one does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ferras

customer_reviews.title: It works! but WARNING!!! ITS NOT FLUSHABLE
customer_reviews.text: It works! but WARNING!!! ITS NOT FLUSHABLE it will clog your drain. soak one over night and there is no change, put one in the washer and there is no change. most or all of the "flushable" diaper liners will not break apart. Does not come wrap individually as per image. size: 6 x 12 could have been wider like 7 inches
customer_reviews.author: D. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect fit in my pocket diapers (we use Mama Koalas). We don't need to use them yet since our baby isn't eating solids but I am so please with the quality and overall size!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like
customer_reviews.text: We have to use two and it still doesn’t absorb all that well, however we do like them because it catches most of the poop depending on how big of a poop it was.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksa

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Work excellent. Sometimes they do bunch up but all liners do this
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my baby dry and the size is appropriate for both infant and AIO diapers. As mentioned in other reviews, the material is much like a wipe due to this reason it tends to stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Dm

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: Makes handling our cloth diaper adventure super easy and convenient while out and about.
customer_reviews.author: E Low

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Kind of pricy but a good product, works great and stays in place unlike other ones we have tried that bunch up
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B.

customer_reviews.title: Buy these
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what you need. Perfect size, perfect feel for babys bum, easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Lara T

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing I have tried a few different brands this is my fav will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Jenika ventura

customer_reviews.title: Too thin
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but it says 600 sheets and it is not enough per one use because it is thin. So it really misguided me, I expected more, esecially for that money. But I love idea.
customer_reviews.author: Yulia Vasyutinskaya

customer_reviews.title: These diaper liners were not as soft as I was ...
customer_reviews.text: These diaper liners were not as soft as I was expecting. The Rearz brand I tried previous to these were much softer so I will not purchase this brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good price!! Super soft , grasp most of the poop. Feels mostly dry when the diaper gets wet.
customer_reviews.author: vamy

customer_reviews.title: We were new to this!
customer_reviews.text: With my youngest 2 I only used these my girls were allergic to diapers! And these were perfect I used 2 in each diaper and never had a huge mess to clean up!! I was unsure about this but someone recommended it to me and it was the best th ok ng ever
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: ... - going to reorder them for the quality and SUPER softness.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the bulk price - going to reorder them for the quality and SUPER softness.
customer_reviews.author: C. Self

customer_reviews.title: Fits Alva pocket diapers perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size to fit vertically in cloth pocket diapers. I use mostly Alva's. I don't need to fold these at all. It's like they were made for Alva's.
customer_reviews.author: Tara P

customer_reviews.title: Gave my kid a rash.
customer_reviews.text: Gave my kid a rash. I will never purchase these again. Sticking with Grovia.
customer_reviews.author: City Mom

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. They absorb pee!
customer_reviews.text: These are awful. They absorb pee and stay wet against baby’s bum! They also bunch up and don’t stay in place. The only positive is they are soft. I have always used the GroVia liners, which aren’t very soft, but at least they are functional. I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: These are great liners, they do not bunch up like other ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great liners, they do not bunch up like other brands. Also, love the quantity for the price.
customer_reviews.author: NicholeF

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: These liners are the first that we've tried so far. We bought them when they still had the cheaper price. Currently all kids using this product in my house are toddlers/preschoolers, but I will have an infant soon. These liners will go into a wad or start to disintegrate. which renders them pretty useless for catching poop. We've found that we have to use THREE in order for them to be effective for catching the poop. I plan to try a different brand of liner to see if the other is more effective with just one or even two liners rather than 3.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: Covers well and soft texture
customer_reviews.text: Covers the perfect area in the diaper to catch solids. Soft on babies bum.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Marinelli

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but I would not recommend flushing them down the toilet. They don't dissolve quickly so they may cause plumbing concerns.
customer_reviews.author: jackie prosise

customer_reviews.title: Changed review due to BIG price jump.
customer_reviews.text: Holy man!! These have had a major price jump!! No thank you, I will just live without. Not that great of a product for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Karolyn

customer_reviews.title: Makes poop manageable
customer_reviews.text: We've used these for several months with our eight month old and Anmababy inserts. Good coverage, makes tossing poops much easier, and it seems to be at least a little bit better for the environment. I prefer the roll format to the stacked storage from other brands; it seems easier to yank off when you're pinning a wily little baby down while the stacks sometimes felt like I was a magician pulling one of those knotted, limitless handkerchiefs out of my throat. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: chris & mairi

customer_reviews.title: Annoying that they are advertised as flushable (don't!), but they are a must
customer_reviews.text: I'd rather be throwing these out than disposable diapers. We use them to help keep as much solid waste from ending up on the diaper. Sometimes it's unavoidable, but I've cut back dramatically on spraying down diapers. I would prefer not to have to fold these every time I prep diapers. It's just one more step in an already lengthy process. I have yet to come across a diaper as wide as these liners are.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for baby shower
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for a baby shower and a few weeks after the baby was born, I got a call saying that they were life savers and that it made super changing super easy. I'm glad I made her momma's day a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!👌 Super soft
customer_reviews.text: Great quality 👌 super soft! Hate the fact that they had spiked the price up and then stop selling the 600 sheets for $39.99.😒 Now they want to sell 200 sheets for a whooping $18.00 and some change.🤔😡 PS: bring back the 600 sheets for $39.99..
customer_reviews.author: Compradora

customer_reviews.title: I love these for all the things!
customer_reviews.text: I brought these to use as baby liners and wipes, but I haven't used them for this purpose yet because the baby isn't here yet. I'll edit the review then, BUT I have been using these to clean like wipes and as toilet paper. I love it! I think I'll be using these as wipes and toilet paper from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Nay

customer_reviews.title: Ease of disposable diapers
customer_reviews.text: We use cloth diapers, and these really work for catching poop and keeping the cloth relatively clean. We are super happy with how well they work. We definitely wouldn’t cloth diaper if we didn’t have the option to use these and throw away the liner. Even with the liners, we are saving money and drastically reducing the amount of waste we put in a landfill, so it’s a win-win situation.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel A

product_meta.title: Bamboo Diaper Liners 600 Sheet Pack, Disposable, Fragrance Free, Chlorine Free, Compostable, Biodegradable Inserts, Dye Free, Cloth Diaper Set of Three Rolls, Bamboo Viscose
feature_bullets: 600 SHEET PACK OF COMPOSTABLE DIAPER LINERS: Soft, fuss-free diaper liners. Kindy Ecobaby Flushable Diaper Liners are the quick and convenient answer for cloth diaper care
MULTI-PURPOSE: As liners for babies and also with incontinence pads/diapers
SIMPLE TO USE: Place a liner in the diaper, Place liner on top of diaper insert closest to baby, Dispose when soiled. No need to awkwardly rinse or scrape poo into the toilet.
SOFT BAMBOO: Kindy Ecobaby Diaper Liners are made of Bamboo viscose in a thickness that offers strength and softness.
EXTRA LONG ROLL, PERFORATED SHEETS: 200 bamboo viscose (100 p/cent viscose derived from bamboo) sheets per roll - totalling 600 sheets Biodegradable and compostable

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
